channel.title: RealGM Basketball Wiretap
channel.description: Basketball News, Rumors, Scores, Stats, Analysis, Depth Charts, Forums

item.title: Giannis Antetokounmpo On Kobe Bryant: I Think We're Very Similar In Some Areas Of Mindset
item.description:
Giannis Antetokounmpo admits he was never close with Kobe Bryant, but he believes his mindset is similar.

"I will never say this, I will never disrespect the name of the great Kobe. I don't like mentioning him," Antetokounmpo told The Athletic when asked to compare their mentalities. "I feel like he should be mentioned, should never be forgotten. But I don't like mentioning his name to bring attention to the conversation that we are about to have. I wasn't close to him. I wasn't this with him or that with him. But I would say this, in some areas of his mindset, I think we're very similar."

In 2018 at the All-Star Game, Antetokounmpo sought out a conversation with Bryant and subsequently worked out with him that next offseason.

"I might not be as talented as him, but when we're talking about a guy that worked extremely hard from his first day until he retired. A guy that plays to win, a guy that pushes himself to the limit, a guy that has a killer mentality when he steps on the court," Antetokounmpo said, as he started to recount that workout. "It's almost like having - I think he had two personalities.

"Like when we were on the sideline and we were talking and I was taking notes, laughing smiling, joking around, talking. But when we stepped on the court, It was like motherf-er didn't even know me. 'I thought you were like my friend.' Again. Again. Again. Again. 'My bad, Kobe. How many more times are we gonna do it?' Twenty-five. 'OK, 25.' No, 25 makes. Twenty-five makes on the same move?' And it's not like you're just shooting. You're going hard. I was like, damn, this guy is different."

item.title: Wolves Waive Eric Paschall From Two-Way
item.description:
The Minnesota Timberwolves have waived Eric Paschall from his Two-Way contract.

Paschall appeared in one preseason game with the Wolves.

Last season, Paschall averaged 5.8 points and 1.8 rebounds in 12.7 minutes with the Utah Jazz.

item.title: LeBron James: Lakers 'Not A Team Constructed Of Great Shooting'
item.description:
The Los Angeles Lakers shot just 10-of-40 on three-pointers in their season-opening loss at the Golden State Warriors. Following the game, LeBron James was frank in his assessment of that part of the Lakers game.

"We're getting great looks, but it could also be teams giving us great looks. To be completely honest, we're not a team constructed of great shooting," James said. "It's not like we're sitting here with a lot of lasers on our team."

Los Angeles' starting five of James, Anthony Davis, Russell Westbrook, Patrick Beverley and Lonnie Walker IV combined to go 5-of-24 from behind the arc. Those failures from distance led Lakers coach Darvin Ham to give Matt Ryan 18 minutes, after Ryan made the team off of a training camp contract. Ham said postgame he was looking for a way to get some shooting on the floor, which Ryan can provide.

item.title: James Bouknight Was Unconscious, Holding Gun When Found By Police
item.description:
James Bouknight was found intoxicated and unconscious and holding a gun with his vehicle in drive before he was arrested Sunday morning on DWI charges.

Police said they responded to reports that a person was passed out in his vehicle in a Charlotte parking lot Sunday morning, blocking traffic.

According to the police report, officers saw Bouknight, 22, unconscious inside the vehicle with the vehicle running and in drive. He had the handgun in his hands. Officers set up a perimeter and attempted to awaken Bouknight for approximately an hour using a public address system, blasting airhorns and using lights.

Once Bouknight was awake, police say he refused to comply with commands and appeared confused for several minutes. They said he ate food inside his vehicle and then crashed into two police cars -- one of front of him and another behind him.

Bouknight eventually exited the vehicle and was detained.

"I just want to apologize for being a distraction before the start of the season for my teammates and what we've got going on," Bouknight said Tuesday. "It's disappointing, but I'm just trying to learn from it, stay strong, move on and continue to grow."

item.title: Hollinger & Duncan: Extension SZN; Notable Season Predictions
item.description:
John Hollinger and Nate Duncan discuss some absolutely fascinating extensions completed over the last week, including Kevin Porter, Jr., DeAndre Hunter, Nassir Little, Jordan Poole, and Andrew Wiggins.

Then John explains his pick of the 76ers to win the championship, and they discuss other season prediction agreements and disagreements.

Sign up here for Dunc'd On Prime, the only place to get all Hollinger & Duncan episodes. If you want to know more about Dunc'd On Prime and why we're making this move, please read this letter from Nate to our listeners.

item.title: Russell Westbrook 'Absolutely' Believes Coming Off Bench Contributed To Hamstring Injury
item.description:
Los Angeles Lakers guard Russell Westbrook played opening night, despite having dealt with hamstring soreness to end the preseason. Westbrook started and logged 31 minutes in the Lakers loss to the Golden State Warriors.

After the game, Westbrook was asked about Lakers coach Darvin Ham experimenting with him coming off the bench to end the preseason. The veteran point guard played fewer than five minutes before exiting with a sore hamstring. Westbrook believes that was caused, in part, by coming off the bench.

"I've been doing the same thing for 14 years straight," Westbrook said. "Honestly I didn't even know what to do pregame."

Postgame, Ham praised Westbrook's contributions and willingness to sacrifice for the team. He did not address if he planned to bring the former All-Star off the bench at during the regular season.

item.title: Jaren Jackson Jr. To 'Hopefully' Return To 5-On-5 Work In Couple Weeks
item.description:
Jaren Jackson Jr. will "hopefully" start 5-on-5 work in the next couple of weeks, according to Taylor Jenkins.

Jackson underwent surgery on his right foot in late June.

Jackson averaged 16.3 points and 5.8 rebounds in 78 games last season.

item.title: Warriors Won't Consider Trading Draymond Green This Season
item.description:
The Golden State Warriors are unlikely to trade Draymond Green this season even though they appear to be more upset about his punch of Jordan Poole than their comments and lack of real punishment indicate.

"From what I've heard talking to people, this iciness that you see in the media comments from Poole, saying, 'You know, we're professionals. I'll leave it at that.'

"From Steve Kerr calling it the biggest crisis they've faced.

"From Kevon Looney saying, 'Draymond is going to have to earn our trust.'

"If anything, I think that may be underplaying the level of iciness and tension that they're navigating right now. And that's not to say 'Are they going to trade Draymond?' Everything I've heard is they are not trading Draymond. They're just not going to happen. They're trying to win the championship and will try to ride it out unless something drastic happens. Draymond is going to be on the team all season."

item.title: Tyrese Haliburton: Being The Full-Time Point Guard Is Everything I Ever Wanted
item.description:
Tyrese Haliburton was initially surprised by his trade from the Sacramento Kings to the Indiana Pacers, but he seems to be embracing his status as the franchise's foundational piece.

"Sacramento was great," Haliburton told Zach Lowe of ESPN. "I wasn't ready to be a full-time point guard when I got there. Playing with [De'Aaron] Fox helped. But now, this is everything I ever wanted. I get to be the full-time guy. I love this."

"In the modern game, where guys love to hold the ball, he's an outlier," says Rick Carlisle, Indiana's coach.

But the Pacers also need Haliburton to score.

"This whole summer has been about challenging my mind and become more of an a--hole in a sense, offensively," Haliburton said.

item.title: Kyrie Irving Admits He Shouldn't Have Asked For Trade From Cavs In 2017
item.description:
During an exclusive sit down interview with Shams Charania before the start of the season, Kyrie Irving reflected on his trade request from the Cleveland Cavaliers in 2017. Irving requested a trade and ultimately was dealt to the Boston Celtics.

"When I asked for a trade from Cleveland, the one thing that I look back on is: Did I exhaust as many opportunities to get closer to guys when I felt some type of difference? There was a lot of things that happened in the business that I didn't understand," he said. "Asking for a trade - I don't think it was my time to ask for a trade. And especially to go to Boston, who was No. 2 or No. 1 in our conference, it's just right down the street. I'm grateful that I had my time there because it was one of the most historical franchises that again, I did not know the power of our industry.

"When I reflect on it, at 30 years old I can say I understand the business better, I understand the way that roles work, and if anybody can sit here honestly and say they messed up, it was me. Because if I'm saying that it is family-run and relationship-run, then while I was in these situations I didn't handle all of those relationships as I would have wanted."

item.title: Kyrie Irving: Nets Got Better After Trade Request By Kevin Durant
item.description:
Kyrie Irving believes the trade request from Kevin Durant made the Brooklyn Nets better in the end.

"When Kev made that request, I feel like we got better," Irving told Shams Charania during a sit-down interview. "Afterwards. Not initially, but now where we are now, I feel like we can honestly say we got better, with the principles that are needed for success. Without going through some test in the summertime or during the season, we wouldn't be able to be as close and bonded as we are now."

The Nets were on the precipice of losing both Irving and Durant this past offseason, but both remain on their roster. Irving could have opted out while Durant perhaps could have continued his machinations to seek a trade.

item.title: Lakers Passed On Utah's Offer Of Bogdanovic, Conley, Gay, 2023 FRP For Westbrook, FRPs In 2027, 2029
item.description:
The Los Angeles Lakers had the opportunity this offseason to acquire Bojan Bogdanovic, Mike Conley, Rudy Gay and a 2023 first round pick from the Utah Jazz in exchange for Russell Westbrook and their first round picks in 2027 and 2029, according to Tony Jones of The Athletic.

Jones doesn't specify which 2023 first round pick the Jazz would have traded to the Lakers, but it presumably would have presumably been either the one from the Minnesota Timberwolves, or the least favorable selection from the Brooklyn Nets, Houston Rockets and Philadelphia 76ers.

The Jazz eventually traded Bogdanovic to the Detroit Pistons.

The Lakers also have had the opportunity to acquire Myles Turner and Buddy Hield for the pair of future first round picks attached to Westbrook.

item.title: Blazers Hire BJ Domingo As Director Of Player Personnel
item.description:
The Portland Trail Blazers have hired BJ Domingo as Director of Player Personnel.

Domingo hand been assistant director of the men's national team at USA Basketball.

Domingo began his career as a scout with the Milwaukee Bucks.

item.title: Victor Oladipo Out Against Bulls With Left Knee Tendonosis
item.description:
Victor Oladipo will miss the Miami Heat's regular-season opener against the Chicago Bulls on Wednesday due to left knee tendonosis.

Erik Spoelstra said that Oladipo would be day-to-day.

"This is part of the process, when a player like Vic ramps it up, and then you add the workload and everything," Erik Spoelstra said. "I think this is normal. And we want to proceed with care. And that's all this is right now.

"He's day-to-day, and we want to make sure we take care of this, so it doesn't linger."

Oladipo has appeared in just 12 regular-season games for the Heat over the past two seasons.

item.title: Vanderbilt Extends Jerry Stackhouse Contract
item.description:
Vanderbilt extended men's basketball coach Jerry Stackhouse's contract on Tuesday.

Stackhouse is entering his fourth season as head coach. Terms of the extension were not announced.

"Committing to and investing in him as the leader is an important part of building the championship caliber program that we all want and expect here at Vanderbilt. I value the contributions Jerry and his program have made to our community and campus, and I am excited about our future," said athletic director Candice Lee.

Stackhouse has coached three Vanderbilt players to the NBA, including Aaron Nesmith, Saben Lee, and Scotty Pippen Jr.

item.title: Zach LaVine Questionable For Season Opener Due To Left Knee Injury Management
item.description:
Zach LaVine is listed as questionable for the Chicago Bulls' regular-season opener against the Miami Heat due to left knee injury management.

LaVine, who signed a five-year, $215 million extension this offseason, underwent knee surgery in May.

Alex Caruso is also listed as probable due to a left calf contusion.

item.title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander To Play Opening Night
item.description:
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is set to play opening night, confirmed Mark Daigneault.

Gilgeous-Alexander suffered an MCL sprain in late September.

The Thunder start the season against the Timberwolves.

item.title: Keegan Murray Ruled Out Of Season Opener Due To COVID-19 Protocols
item.description:
Keegan Murray will miss the Sacramento Kings' regular season opener against the Portland Trail Blazers as he remains in COVID-19 protocols.

Murray entered health and safety protocols last Friday night.

Kevin Huerter is questionable for the game due to ankle soreness, though he did practice on Tuesday.

item.title: Stephen Curry: End Of Our Run Should Only Come When We're No Longer Title Contenders
item.description:
Some in the media have suggested this could be a 'Last Dance' season for the Golden State Warriors due to the uncertain future of Draymond Green both in response to his fight with Jordan Poole but also his contract status. The Warriors already have an exorbitant salary plus luxury tax bill that will climb even further next season if Green remains.

Stephen Curry was asked in an exclusive interview with Shayna Rubin to comment on the possibility of this season being the last season with a core of himself, Green and Klay Thompson.

"Whenever someone has success, the imagination wanders to when the end is and what is going to be the reason that it unfolds," said Curry.

"I heard it back in 2019. I heard during the pandemic. We hear it a little louder now because we won again. We would have heard it louder had we not won. Nobody has any idea what's going to happen.

"Nobody last year could have guessed that JP (Jordan Poole) and Wiggs (Andrew Wiggins) would be in the situation they are in now. Potentially being coveted free agents that we locked into extensions. Not a lot of people put money on that.

"The conversations are part of what we do. For Draymond, Klay, me, we've been through it and we're used to it. We hope that the end is when we don't win. That should be the end, when there's a sense that we're not a championship contending team. We know it's not guaranteed to win a championship. When we know we're a team that can legitimately win championships then you make certain decisions. We haven't been in that situation."

item.title: Thomas Bryant Undergoes Surgery On Left Thumb
item.description:
Thomas Bryant underwent successful surgery on Tuesday to repair the ulnar collateral ligament on his left thumb.

Bryant will be reevaluated by team doctors in approximately three weeks, and further updates will be provided at that time.

Bryant signed with the Los Angeles Lakers this past offseason.

item.title: Robert Williams III Underwent PRP Procedure On Monday
item.description:
Robert Williams III underwent a PRP procedure in his knee on Monday to help with the healing process.

Williams hopes to return in December or January, but he could return well into the second half of the season.

Williams also underwent surgery in September.

item.title: Justin Zanik Signs Multi-Year Extension With Jazz
item.description:
The Utah Jazz have signed General Manager Justin Zanik to a multi-year contract extension.

"My family and I have fallen in love with this great city and the state of Utah, and I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to continue this journey with the Utah Jazz," said Zanik. "I have a deep appreciation for my partnership with Ryan and Danny and am excited about our path forward with Coach Hardy. We look forward to building towards winning the championship our fans deserve."

"Justin's basketball acumen, ability to create meaningful relationships throughout the league, and management of our front office are invaluable assets," said Jazz CEO of Basketball Danny Ainge. "We're thrilled that he'll continue to lead the team."

Zanik is entering his fourth season as general manager of the Utah Jazz, overseeing the day-to-day management of basketball operations. Zanik originally joined the Jazz as assistant general manager in September 2013 and held the role for three seasons, before moving to take on the role of assistant general manager for the Milwaukee Bucks in 2016-17. He returned to Utah in the same role from 2017-19.

item.title: Klay Thompson, Warriors Didn't Talk Extension Before Deadline
item.description:
Klay Thompson and the Golden State Warriors had a Monday deadline to reach agreement on a contract extension. According to Thompson, he and the team never even broached the topic of an extension.

When asked about a potential extension, Thompson said, "I have not talked to the front office about it."

Asked about how he expects things to play out with the Warriors, Thompson said he's focused on his game and playing to the best of his ability.

"I'm just going to do what I got to do to be the best I can be every day. I'm going to be a great player. I know what I'm capable of. I fully expect to earn another NBA contract, whether it's this summer or next summer.," Thompson said. "I'm fully confident in my abilities. I'm not worried about an extension in the meantime because I know it'll happen if I just do my job and I just be myself."

Because Thompson has two seasons left on his deal, he and Golden State had to reach an agreement on an extension by the end of the day on Monday. Extension-eligible players who are on expiring contracts can sign veteran extensions through the last day of the league year on June 30.

item.title: Nets Exercise 23-24 Options For Day'Ron Sharpe, Cam Thomas
item.description:
The Brooklyn Nets exercised 2023-24 rookie scale team options for Day'Ron Sharpe and Cam Thomas. These were third-year options for both players.

Sharpe appeared in 32 games (eight starts) as a rookie last season. He averaged 6.2 points and 5.0 rebounds in 12.2 minutes per game. This season, Sharpe may see a bigger role, as Brooklyn is in need of center depth behind Nicolas Claxton.

Thomas saw action in 67 games (two starts) as a rookie. He averaged 8.5 points on 43% shooting from the field. Thomas is expected to see increased minutes early in the season as both Seth Curry and Joe Harris continue to recover from ankle surgeries.

item.title: Andre Iguodala Inactive To Start Season, Patrick Baldwin Jr. Questionable With Thumb Sprain
item.description:
Andre Iguodala will be inactive to the start the Golden State Warriors' season.

Iguodala, who signed a one-year deal to return to the Warriors, will retire after this year.

The Warriors open the regular season against the Lakers on Tuesday.

Patrick Baldwin Jr. is also listed as questionable with a sprained right thumb for the opener.

item.title: Paolo Banchero Signs Endorsement Deal With Jordan Brand
item.description:
Paolo Banchero signed a multi-year endorsement deal with Jordan Brand.

"The marketing and the product, and just how exclusive they are. Jordan, to me, is real sharp and stylish at the same time. I feel like that fit me real well," said Banchero on what lead him to choose Jordan Brand.

Banchero also drew interest from Adidas and Puma.

The deal was negotiated by Mike Miller's LIFT Sports Management.

Banchero will wear several Jordan models this season, including the Luka 1, Zion 2, and the mid and low-top cuts of the Air Jordan 37.

item.title: James Bouknight Charged With DWI
item.description:
James Bouknight was arrested on Sunday morning and charged with driving while impaired in Charlotte.

Bouknight's bond was set at $2500.

The 22-year-old practiced on Monday but did not speak to reporters.

"We are just gathering information right now. Until we know more definitely on what happened I can't comment on that," said Steve Clifford after Monday's practice.

Bouknight averaged 4.6 points in 31 games last season as a rookie.

item.title: Spurs Waive Joe Wieskamp
item.description:
The San Antonio Spurs waived Joe Wieskamp on Monday, cutting their roster down to 15 players ahead of the regular season.

Wieskamp appeared in 29 games for the Spurs last season.

item.title: Get Your Latest NBA News From RealGM's Basketball Wiretap
item.description: Get all the latest news and happenings from around the NBA with RealGM's Basketball Wiretap.
